Sequence Information.Peptide Name: hRETN (human resistin, natural AMPs; primates; mammals, animals; UCSS)

Literature.Author: Harris TA, Gattu S, Propheter DC, Kuang Z, Bel S, Ruhn KA, Chara AL, Edwards M, Zhang C, Jo JH, Raj P, Zouboulis CC, Kong HH, Segre JA, Hooper LV.2019
Literature.Title: Resistin-like Molecule alpha Provides Vitamin-A-Dependent Antimicrobial Protection in the Skin

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of the peptide shows 27.5% similarity toCarnolysin.Discovery: Vatamin A deficiency increases the risk of skin infection. Why? Hooper and colleagues found that vitamin A can induce the expression of human resistin, which has antimicrobial effect. This deepens our understanding of the role of vitamins in skin innate immunity. Read thecommentary hereof this work. For a review, seeLi et al. 2021.Activity: Active against S. epidermidis,  S. pyogenes,  and L. monocytogenes.Antimicrobial robustness: RELMalpha bactericidal activity is pH-sensitive. RELMalpha bactericidal activity is inhibited by cholesterol.updated 7/2019; 7/2021.
